Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2010 04:12PM NewBride wrote: Hi, I am the newbie here and DX'd at age 50.  Found 1.1cm tumor in pathology after MX of left breast for 4cm DCIS.  Sneaky colloid carcinoma evaded 2 mammos , stereotactic core needle biopsy (just missed it) and review by 2 different breast surgeons.  Long story short- no SNB.  Now what?  I go to oncologist on Fri. but would love to hear what you have to say in the mean time.  Thanks
Posts.Title: mucinous or colloid ductal carcinoma Sherri_V NewBride

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2010 10:25PM NewBride wrote: Here's the latest.  My BS is bringing my case up for dicussion on breast board (like a tumor board but for BC only).  Hopefully something helpful will result from that.  I'll let you know. Wish me luck at the oncologist consult tomorrow. I hope you are all doing well.  This is kind of a lonely little thread.  I suppose that is because colloid carcinoma is so rare.  Please direct me to other areas where I can find info if you know of them.  Thanks.
Posts.Title: mucinous or colloid ductal carcinoma Sherri_V NewBride
